title: NYC, Long a City of Contradictions, Is Still Turning Up New Ones
summary: New York City has often set the political, cultural and financial course of the country. Tuesday’s mayoral election — and a New Yorker watching from Washington — could scramble it all.

title: Trump’s Team Offers to Keep Some Ballroom Donors Incognito
summary: Many corporate interests that have donated to the president’s pet project have business before his administration.

title: Trump Threatens Military Action in Nigeria Over Protections for Christians
summary: Accusing Nigeria of not doing enough to protect Christians from violence, President Trump said he had ordered the Pentagon to prepare for action.

title: Uncertainty Persists for Americans Waiting for Food Benefits After SNAP Ruling
summary: Judges on Friday ordered the federal government to continue providing food assistance during the shutdown. But benefits will still most likely be interrupted.

title: Trump Administration Must Make Food Stamp Payments Within Days, Judge Says
summary: The written order came one day after a court told the Trump administration it must pay benefits in the program known as SNAP during the shutdown.

title: California Promised Insurance Relief, But Delivered Loopholes
summary: New regulations were supposed to ensure that homeowners in fire zones would have coverage available. But companies can still avoid serving many high-risk areas, a Times investigation found.

title: A Third Trump Term Is Not the Charm
summary: The Constitution is not a word game.

title: Dawn of the Zombie Mall
summary: What does it mean when a cultural epicenter is poised to be little more than a dearly departed corpse?

title: Explosion at Harvard Medical School Was ‘Intentional,’ Officials Say
summary: Two people were seen running from the building afterward, the school said. No injuries were reported, the school police said.

title: In One Jamaican Town, Hurricane Melissa Left Behind Floodwaters and Dead Livestock
summary: The Category 5 storm ravaged western Jamaica and drenched the small community of New River, where residents were coping with a massive clean up. At least 19 people have died nationwide, officials said.

title: Zoë Wicomb, Acclaimed South African Author, Dies at 76
summary: In novels and short stories, she delivered sharp observations of the constraints and contradictions of apartheid and its aftermath.

title: NYC Marathon Guide 2025: The Route, Start Times and More
summary: Everything you need to know about Sunday’s five-borough race.
